New Records: Anthony Volpe set a record for a single playoffs with the ninth World Series grand slam in Yankees history.
Volpe became the first Yankee with a grand slam and multiple stolen bases in a game, regular season or postseason, since Mickey Mantle on Aug. 19, 1962.
This is just the fourth World Series with multiple grand slams.
11 runs were the Yankeesâ€™ most in a World Series game since 1978 Game 5 (12).
Freddie Freeman has now homered in six consecutive World Series games, breaking a tie with George Springer.
Freeman has 10 RBIs this series, passing Gil Hodges (1956) and Duke Snider (1952) for most RBIs in a World Series in Dodgers history.
Freeman's 10 RBIs are the most in the first four games of a World Series, ahead of Tony Fernandez (1993), Bobby Richardson (1960) and Lou Gehrig (1928).
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a grand slam in the third inning.
Freddie Freeman homered in the first inning.
Volpe added an eighth-inning double to spark a five-run frame.
